subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: SchemaCrawler looks for potential database design issues. Follow the steps below to run SchemaCrawler Lint.

ol.li:
Follow the instructions in the
commandline
example
To find schema design issues, run sc.cmd -infolevel=standard -command=lint (or sc.sh -infolevel=standard -command=lint on Unix)
Create the SchemaCrawler Lint report in HTML5 and JSON formats.

li.p: Create a customized SchemaCrawler Lint report using a linter configuration file.
Start a command shell in the lint example directory.

To find schema design issues, run java -Dschemacrawer.linter_configs.file=schemacrawler-linter-configs.xml -cp ..\_schemacrawler\lib\hsqldb-2.2.8.jar;..\_schemacrawler\lib\schemacrawler-9.0.jar;..\_schemacrawler\lib\schemacrawler-hsqldb-9.0.jar;..\_schemacrawler\lib\schemacrawler-lint-9.0.jar schemacrawler.tools.hsqldb.Main -database=schemacrawler -user=sa -password= -infolevel=standard -command=lint
(or java -Dschemacrawer.linter_configs.file=schemacrawler-linter-configs.xml -cp ../_schemacrawler/lib/hsqldb-2.2.8.jar:../_schemacrawler/lib/schemacrawler-9.0.jar:../_schemacrawler/lib/schemacrawler-hsqldb-9.0.jar:../_schemacrawler/lib/schemacrawler-lint-9.0.jar schemacrawler.tools.hsqldb.Main -database=schemacrawler -user=sa -password= -infolevel=standard -command=lint
on Unix)

ol.li: Try creating your own database lints in a new jar - see SchemaCrawler Lint .
